1) "The Great Gatsby" (1949) directed by Louis B. Mayer & George Cukor. Based on F. Scott Fitzgerald's iconic novel, this film stars Leonardo DiCaprio as Jay Gatsby, along with Rachel McAdams as Daisy Buchanan and Tom Hardy as Nick Carraway.

2) "The Dark Knight" (2008) directed by Christopher Nolan. This film is a sequel to 2005's "Batman Begins" directed by Christopher Nolan, which serves as the origin story for Bruce Wayne, Batman of Gotham City.

3) "We're the Millers" (2012) directed by Jason Reitman. The plot revolves around three criminals: Ben, who is an alcoholic; Luis, who is a drug addict; and Eric, who is just plain stupid. While they are planning their next heist, they receive unexpected visitors: one of their bank tellers, who has been secretly working against them; and a young woman named Sarah, who happens to be the target of their next heist.

Based on your preferences for genre and storyline, "The Great Gatsby" (1949) directed by Louis B. Mayer & George Cukor, "The Dark Knight" (2008) directed by Christopher Nolan, and "We're the Millers" (2012) directed by Jason Reitman might be worth considering.
